content.webTitle: VW braced for battle with unions over hours

fields.headline: VW braced for battle with unions over hours
fields.bodyText: Volkswagen, Europe's biggest carmaker, is heading for a showdown with its 100,000 German workers after trade unions rejected proposals to increase the working week to 35 hours without extra pay. Horst Neumann, VW's personnel director, further raised the hackles of IG Metall, the engineering union, by warning that thousands of jobs could be axed and indicating that a 2004 agreement ruling out compulsory redundancies until 2011 could be renegotiated. VW has assured investors it will carry out a savage restructuring programme at its core Volkswagen brand.
